job.title: App for Windows Store - Proof Of Concept
job.description:
📍 Proxy Browser
We are looking for a Windows App developer who can assist us in building a Proxy browser app designed for the Windows Store. To keep things simple, the initial scope will include a proof of concept that explores the technical feasibility of the core functionality.

 Requirements for Proof of Concept

➡️ General Information:
---------------------------------
👉 Ability to submit the installer into the Windows Store in .appxupload format (cannot be an exe file).
👉 Maximum possible support for Windows OS (10, 11), including Xbox.
👉 Ideally written in XAML, C#.
👉 Source code included - as a Github repository
👉 Time and willingness to continue on other phases of this project, which will include implementation of final design, browser tabs, advanced functionality like communication between Webview content and app frame using postMessage

➡️ Functionality:
---------------------------------
👉 Core functionality: The Webview2 component can load webpages via a proxy server to simulate webpages from different locations.
👉 Ability to switch between 2 proxy servers (more in the future) in real-time using a location switcher. The location switch will result in a page reload in Webview2 via a different proxy server.
👉 Proxy server credentials will be delivered before the project starts.
👉 Basic navigation for navigating within Webview2.
   - Back, Forward, Go to Home page (e.g., google.com).
   - An address bar where the URL of some webpage can be inserted.
👉 Safely stored proxy credentials to prevent compromise.
👉 Design in the current phase does not matter - keep focus on functionality and make things as simple as possible.

customFields.generatedDescriptionAI:
We are looking for an experienced developer to create a proof of concept app for the Windows Store. The app will be developed using C# and XAML. The project is expected to be completed in less than 1 month.

The candidate should submit a proposal detailing their experience and how they can assist with the project. We are particularly interested in candidates who have prior experience developing apps for the Windows Store and who are proficient in C# and XAML.

Please include links to past completed projects that demonstrate your skills in app development for the Windows Store. We will review all proposals and select the candidate who best meets our requirements and demonstrates the ability to deliver a high-quality proof of concept app.
